headline.main: PETAIN CONFINES 7 FOR FRANCE'S FALL; Gamelin, Daladier, Blum, Man- del, Reynaud Are Sentenced to Pyrenees Fortress

lead_paragraph: VICHY, France, Oct. 16 -- Charged with having failed in their official duties and engaged France in the war unprepared, General Maurice Gamelin, ex-Premiers Edouard Daladier, Leon Blum and Paul Reynaud, and former Minister of Interior Georges Mandel, have been ordered confined in the Pyrenees fortress of Pourtalet by the verdict of Marshal Henri Philippe Petain, announced here tonight in a broadcast to the nation.
abstract: Petain orders Gamelin, Daladier, Blum, Mandel and Reynaud confined to Pourtales fortress; action deferred on P Cot, in U S; G La Chambre and P Jacomet to remain interned at Bourassol Manor; Riom ct to try all later
